trans-unit.source: Represents one or multiple databases that are used by ASP.NET Dynamic Data.
The <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaModel> type lets you register one or multiple data contexts for a Dynamic Data Web application.
A data context is an object that represents a database connection.
A data context has access to one data model which represents a database that is available through that connection.
A data model is an object that represents a database's data entities as CLR types.
Dynamic Data supports data models based on LINQ to SQL and on the ADO.NET Entity Framework.
In [!INCLUDE[vsprvs](~/includes/vsprvs-md.md)], you can generate data-model types by using the **LINQ to SQL Classes** template or the **ADO.NET Entity Data Model** template.
These templates use the Object Relational Designer (O/R Designer) for the LINQ to SQL model, or the ADO.NET Entity Data Model Designer (Entity Designer) for the Entity Framework model.
Instantiates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.MetaModel"></xref> class.
You typically call the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaModel.%23ctor%2A> constructor in the `Application_Start` method of the Global.asax file.
Instantiates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.MetaModel"></xref> class.
This constructor determines whether the data model is registered globally so that it can be retrieved using the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaModel.GetModel%2A> method.
It enables you to create multiple models and use the same entity types while avoiding type conflicts.
You typically call the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaModel.%23ctor%2A> constructor in the `Application_Start` method of the Global.asax file.
`true` to indicate that the model is registered globally; otherwise `false`.
The default is `true`.
Instantiates a <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.MetaTable"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaModel.CreateTable%2A> method can be overridden to instantiate a derived type.
The provider for the table.
A new instance of the table.
Gets the first instance of a data model that is created by the application.
This property provides a simple way to reference the default data-model instance.
If the application uses multiple models, you must provide your own way to store references to the additional data models.
To find a specific data model, call the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaModel.GetModel%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
The data-model instance.
Gets or sets the virtual path of the DynamicData folder in the Web site.
This property enables you to change the virtual path of the DynamicData folder.
The default value is "~/DynamicData".
The virtual path of the DynamicData folder.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.EntityTemplateFactory"></xref> object that is associated with the model.
An instance of the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.EntityTemplateFactory"></xref> object that is associated with the model.
Gets or sets a custom <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.IFieldTemplateFactory"></xref> interface.
The <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.IFieldTemplateFactory> interface lets you specify which field templates are created for the table columns.
The <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.IFieldTemplateFactory"></xref> interface.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.FilterFactory"></xref> object that is associated with the model.
An instance of the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.FilterFactory"></xref> object that is associated with the model.
Returns the action path that is associated with a specific table.
The route is determined by the combination of the table name and action.
[Run](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=120736&sref=System.Web.DynamicData.MetaModel&spage=PathModel.aspx) an online example of this feature.
The name of the table that the action applies to.
The action to apply to the table.
An object that represents a single row of data in a table.
row is used to provide values for query-string parameters.
The URL that is associated with the route.
Returns the data-model instance for the specified context.
The type of the data context as defined in the data model.
The data model that is associated with the specified context type.
Returns the metadata that describes the specified table.
The name of the table.
The data context to search for the table.
The metadata that describes the specified table.
tablename or contextType is `null`.
The context is not registered or the table does not exist in the data context.
Returns the metadata that describes the specified table.
The type that identifies the table in the data model.
The metadata that describes the specified table.
The type was not found in the data model.
Returns the metadata that is associated with the specified table.
The name uniquely identifies a table in the data model and is used to generate the related URL for routing.
The name that identifies the table in the data model.
The metadata that describes the specified table.
The name was not found in the data model.
Registers the data context that is specified by a context factory.
This method uses the default context information that is defined by the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.ContextConfiguration> class.
It enables you to instantiate the data context by using your own constructor.
The factory for instantiating the data context.
Registers a data-context instance.
This method uses the default context information as defined by the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.ContextConfiguration> class.
The type of the data context as defined in the data model.
Registers a data context instance by using a data-model provider
A provider for the data model.
Registers a data-context instance by using the specified context configuration and by enabling a custom constructor.
The context factory in this method enables you to instantiate a data model context by using a custom constructor.
A delegate that is used to instantiate the data model context.
The context information as defined by the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.ContextConfiguration"></xref> class.
contextFactory is `null`.
The contextType that is instantiated by contextFactory is not valid.
Registers a data-context instance by using the specified context configuration.
The type of the data context as defined in the data model.
The configuration information for the context, as defined by the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.ContextConfiguration"></xref> class.
contextType is `null`.
Registers a data-context instance by using the specified context configuration and by enabling a data-model provider.
A provider for the data model.
The context information as defined by the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.ContextConfiguration"></xref> class.
dataModelProvider or configuration is `null`.
contextType is already registered.
Resets any previous context registration error that might have occurred.
When an error occurs during data-context registration, the exception is cached and thrown on all subsequent operations.
For example, if an error occurs at application start, it is thrown on every request.
Call this method to clear the error and to enable a new context registration to be performed.
Gets a collection of all the tables that are part of the data model.
The collection contains all the tables in the data model, which includes the tables that are not visible (are not part of Dynamic Data scaffolding).
[Run](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=120736&sref=System.Web.DynamicData.MetaModel&spage=TablesMenu.aspx) an online example of this feature.
A collection that contains the tables that belong to the data model.
Attempts to get the metadata that is associated with the specified table.
This method gets the metadata that is associated with the specified table.
If the table is not found, this method returns `false`.
This differs from the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaModel.GetTable%2A> method, which throws an exception if the table is not found.
The name that uniquely identifies the table.
When this method returns, and if it has found the requested table, contains the metadata for that table.
This parameter is passed uninitialized.
`true` if the table metadata is found; otherwise `false`.
uniqueTableName is `null`.
Attempts to get the metadata that is associated with the specified table.
This method gets the metadata that is associated with the specified table.
If the table is not found, this method returns `false`.
This differs from the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaModel.GetTable%2A> method, which throws an exception if the table is not found.
The table type.
When this method returns, and if the requested table has been found, contains the metadata for the specified table.
This parameter is passed uninitialized.
`true` if the table metadata is found; otherwise, `false`.
entityType is `null`.
Gets a collection of the visible tables in the data model.
A visible table refers to a table that has scaffolding enabled.
This means that it is a table for which a List.aspx page exists.
